author: travelandtourworld.com
title: Tourism numbers spike in Winnipeg this summerTravelandtourworld.com
text:
Tourism numbers spike in Winnipeg this summer Published on : Friday, September 4, 2015
Winnipeg witnessed a robust tourism growth this summer, thanks to the Women’s FIFA World Cup which the city hosted in June this year. Following the event, the flow of tourists has remained strong.
There was a 50% increase in border crossings in June as compared to last year, Travel Manitoba’s Linda Whitfield reveals.
The Assiniboine Park Zoo received more than 195,000 visitors while FortWhyte Alive welcomed more than 18,000 visits.
Events such as Jazz Fes also brought visitors to the downtown core.
Meanwhile, the Canadian Museum for Human Rights had around 140,000 visits, a 30% spike in the summer months.
